member_organisations:
All member and affiliates of the European Evangelical Alliance are listed in our website: 
http://www.europeanea.org/index.php/members/
fields_of_interest: Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Culture and media, Culture, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Migration and asylum
eu_initiatives:
The European Evangelical Alliance follows closely EU initiatives on Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms such as Freedom of Speech and Freedom of Religion or Belief in Europe and around the world.  
Other areas of interest include EU initiatives to tackle the Migration crisis as well as its efforts to fight poverty and social exclusion.
section: V - Organisations representing churches and religious communities
subsection: Organisations representing churches and religious communities
membership: The EEA, a region of the World Evangelical Alliance, is a member of the European Platform on Religious Intolerance and Discrimination (EPRID).
goals__remit: The EEA, originally created in 1846, is a pan-European movement representing more than 50 national and international evangelical Protestant organisations in 36 nations, and 20 million citizens in the EU. The Brussels office of the EEA promotes active citizenship of its constituency and represents it to the European Institutions.
inter_groups: The European Evangelical participates in the European Parliament Intergroup on Freedom of Religion or Belief and Religious Tolerance.
relevant_communication:
The European Evangelical Alliance organises Europe wide campaigns and communication initiatives. We also encourage our members to develop a mentality of active and participatory citizenship by organising their own projects and initiatives.  
We conduct our communication activities mainly through our website and media organisations affiliated with local partners. We also publish a bimonthly newsletter that is sent to 450 participants.
